column4: I cannot unmount an external drive, I'm getting "WD_320GB': Device or resource busy"
how do you find out what's using the "resource"?
fuser
well, even a reboot didn't free the resource
ive even tried to remove the folder in /media
fuser -m /media/mountpoint
removing that folder will delete your data
well that's not good!
still get "device or resource is busy" after a fuser -m /media/mountpoint
what was the output of the fuser.... (replace mountpoint with your actual dir, teh drive is mounted to)
http://pastebin.com/z5Cu28AW
psusi: http://pastebin.com/z5Cu28AW
quiet a lot, "ps -p 1439"
gnome-keyring-d  . the keyring? huh?
redo that with all listed pids
well it's funny because the external hard drive is off so how can it be "busy"?
when I turn it on it mounts as something different "WD_320GB_". Is there something wrong with the first mount point or something?
Frijolie "grep WD_320 /etc/mtab"
blank
sorry no idea how to solve it, seem to be a gnome-diskmount issue
well thanks for trying
